newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Glaxo Wellcome opens Hungary facility.
newsitem.headline: Glaxo Wellcome opens Hungary facility.

text.p: The Hungarian subsidiary of pharmaceuticals company Glaxo Wellcome Plc inaugurated a new 1.5 billion forint greenfield investment on Monday, the company said.
The new project includes a packaging plant, a storage facility and an office building in Torokbalint, near Budapest, it said in a statement.
The new plant will package all Glaxo Wellcome medicines sold in Hungary and will create 20 to 25 new jobs, MTI Econews news agency said.
Glaxo is involved in pharmaceutical trading and research in Hungary. It opened its first office there in 1985, the company said.
